#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Participate in SETI
#Text=Distributed Computing ( DC ) is a popular way to contribute your spare computer time to worthwhile causes .
#Text=While your screensaver is idling away , your computer does work for an outside project like SETI@Home .
#Text=Your computer will scan telescope and satellite data sent by SETI for signs of alien civilizations .
#Text=This guide will help you excel at distributed-computing projects like SETI ( Search for Extra-Terrestrial Intelligence ) .

#Text=If excelling does n't bother you , it will introduce you to the BOINC ( Berkeley Open Infrastructure for Network Computing ) software , and the range of good causes that your spare processing time can contribute to .
#Text=You 'll need a computer .
#Text=If you 've got one already , just install the BOINC software .
#Text=There 's plenty of projects to choose from if Seti@Home is n't your thing .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Let 's start building a monster computer that will excel at distributed computing tasks .
#Text=Image : Build a Seti Supercomputer Step 1 . jpg
#Text=Get a good motherboard .
#Text=Get one with support for plenty of RAM , but crucially , seek multi-processor support .
#Text=The more processors you jam into the computer , the more simultaneous tasks you can undertake .
#Text=Also , for the fastest upgrade path , get one with 64 bit support .
#Text=Image : Build a Seti Supercomputer Step 2 . jpg
#Text=Put in enough RAM to do this stuff .
#Text=Nowadays , you can get up to 128GB of RAM on consumer platforms ( LGA 2011-V3 ) .
#Text=Better make it the fastest RAM ( that your chipset/CPU clock speed will allow ) .
#Text=Image : Build a Seti Supercomputer Step 3 . jpg
#Text=Fit as many processors as your motherboard allows , and make them expensive , powerful ones .
#Text=The more expensive and powerful the better .
#Text=Server processors are better in some categories than normal processors .
#Text=Image : Build a Seti Supercomputer Step 4 . jpg
#Text=For extreme

#Text=Seti performance you will need a powerful GPU , get the latest high end graphics card , or ideally more than one ( nvidia is better at this ) ! Its trickier configuring the Bionic Manager to get all the cards/cores to work at the same time but if you do , this will blow away any CPU on the market .
#Text=Period .
#Text=Image : Build a Seti Supercomputer Step 5 . jpg
#Text=Install an operating system with the least amount of overhead .
#Text=If you want to avoid learning a new operating system , use one in which you are comfortable installing and using .
#Text=Operating systems in order of least overhead :
#Text=Image : Build a Seti Supercomputer Step 6 . jpg
#Text=LimeTech unRAID ( If you want to run multiple Operating Systems )
#Text=Windows Server 2016/2013 r2
#Text=MacOS X ( Snow Leopard )
#Text=Windows 10
#Text=Download and Install the BOINC software that Seti@Home and the other Good Causes runs on .
#Text=Image : Build a Seti Supercomputer Step 7 . jpg
#Text=Get the URL of the project you want to join ( eg .
#Text=http://setiathome.berkeley.edu/
#Text=) .
#Text=Type the URL into BOINC , and it will download work-units ( WUs ) to start processing .
#Text=Image : Build a Seti Supercomputer Step 8 . jpg
#Text=Start crunching those SETI ( or other Good Cause ) packets .
#Text=Image : Build a Seti Supercomputer Step 9 . jpg
#Text=Graphs and statistics are provided in the software , so you can track your progress .
#Text=Good Luck !
#Text=Image : Build a Seti Supercomputer Step 10 . jpg
#Text=Tips
#Text=Follow your data-crunching progress on the graphs and league tables the BOINC software provides , and track your individual or team progress .
#Text=It 's surprisingly addictive charitable hobby .
#Text=A processor that does well at data processing ( like video editing ) , will also do well at DC number crunching .
#Text=If you do n't want to spend money on a super computer , do n't worry .
#Text=Your old computer is just as good , every bit of help counts .
#Text=Intel 's multi-processors have a better number-crunching speed than AMD , so once they are launched , better change to them .
#Text=Installing a 64-bit OS will impact on your existing programs .
#Text=Do they all support 64-bit operation ?
#Text=And make sure your motherboard has 64 bit drivers for Windows too , or else it wo n't run properly .
#Text=BOINC has a list of projects running :
#Text=BBC Climate Change Experiment - Study of transient climate change model predictions .
#Text=Climateprediction.net ( CPDN ) - Study of climate change models .
#Text=Einstein@Home - Search for gravitational waves .
#Text=LHC@Home - Model and improve the design of the CERN LHC particle accelerator .
#Text=Predictor@Home - Investigate protein behavior .
#Text=Rosetta@Home - Predict and design protein structures , and protein-protein and protein-ligand interactions using the Rosetta program .
#Text=SETI@Home - Look for radio evidence of extraterrestrial life .
#Text=SIMAP@Home - Apple Macintosh OS-X : in preparation
#Text=SZTAKI Desktop Grid -
#Text=This project is exploring a mathematical domain looking for solutions to a particular problem space .
#Text=World Community Grid - This project explores solutions to AIDS , the food supply decrease , and other things .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=If you get caught up in DC fever , beware of leaving your computer on day-and-night to try to get those league table credits .
#Text=A computer left on 24 hours may increase your electricity bill by up to 30 % , ( make sure to Turn-Off your Monitor and any unnecessary electronics around your house )
#Text=DC Good Causes are seriously addictive !
#Text=Some 64-bit motherboards seem to have been sold without drivers for the 64-bit version of Windows XP .
#Text=This will ruin your experience , so roll back to regular XP until your motherboard manufacturer releases proper drivers .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Enough money to buy the parts , or your existing computer will do .
#Text=A top of the line CPU is around $ 1700 to even $ 4500 !
#Text=References
#Text=Seti@Home
#Text=BOINC
#Text=- for all the good causes .
#Text=Projects
#Text=where you 'll find all the BOINC projects .
